testcase.name: EditTool > applyReplacement > should return newString if isNewFile is true
EditTool > applyReplacement > should return newString if currentContent is null and oldString is empty (defensive)
EditTool > applyReplacement > should return empty string if currentContent is null and oldString is not empty (defensive)
EditTool > applyReplacement > should replace oldString with newString in currentContent
EditTool > applyReplacement > should return currentContent if oldString is empty and not a new file
EditTool > validateToolParams > should return null for valid params
EditTool > validateToolParams > should return error for relative path
EditTool > validateToolParams > should return error for path outside root
EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should throw an error if params are invalid
EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should request confirmation for valid edit
EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should return false if old_string is not found
testcase.system-out: Error: Failed to edit, could not find the string to replace. Re-read the file and copy the exact bytes.

testcase.name: EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should return false if multiple occurrences of old_string are found
testcase.system-out: Error: Failed to edit, expected 1 occurrence but found 2.

testcase.name: EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should request confirmation for creating a new file (empty old_string)
EditTool > shouldConfirmExecute > should use corrected params from ensureCorrectEdit for diff generation
EditTool > execute > should throw error if file path is not absolute
EditTool > execute > should throw error if file path is empty
EditTool > execute > should edit an existing file and return diff with fileName
EditTool > execute > should create a new file if old_string is empty and file does not exist, and return created message
EditTool > execute > should return error if old_string is not found in file
EditTool > execute > should return error if multiple occurrences of old_string are found
EditTool > execute > should successfully replace multiple occurrences when expected_replacements specified
EditTool > execute > should return error if expected_replacements does not match actual occurrences
EditTool > execute > should return error if trying to create a file that already exists (empty old_string)
EditTool > execute > should include modification message when proposed content is modified
EditTool > execute > should not include modification message when proposed content is not modified
EditTool > execute > should not include modification message when modified_by_user is not provided
EditTool > execute > should return error if old_string and new_string are identical
EditTool > execute > should return EDIT_NO_CHANGE error if replacement results in identical content
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return FILE_NOT_FOUND error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return ATTEMPT_TO_CREATE_EXISTING_FILE error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return NO_OCCURRENCE_FOUND error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return EXPECTED_OCCURRENCE_MISMATCH error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return NO_CHANGE error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should throw INVALID_PARAMETERS error for relative path
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should return FILE_WRITE_FAILURE on write error
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should normalize CRLF line endings in parameters
EditTool > Error Scenarios > should include a context hint when the snippet is not found
EditTool > getDescription > should return "No file changes to..." if old_string and new_string are the same
EditTool > getDescription > should return a snippet of old and new strings if they are different
EditTool > getDescription > should handle very short strings correctly in the description
EditTool > getDescription > should truncate long strings in the description
EditTool > workspace boundary validation > should validate paths are within workspace root
EditTool > workspace boundary validation > should reject paths outside workspace root
EditTool > IDE mode > should call ideClient.openDiff and update params on confirmation
